Date Masamune sent a mission to Rome via the Americas and Spain in
1614.

Hasekura Tsunenaga was the senior Japanese official, but whilst away
Ieyasu turned against the Christians, word of which reached Rome, 
and the mission returned having achieved nothing some 4 years later.

The Franciscan monk Fr Luis Sotelo, who organised the mission, had in
mind a crusade to convert Japan, and thus realise his own ambition of 
becoming the Primate of that country.

Thomas
